item.title: Publications
item.description: Peer-reviewed journal articles Boehm, Frederick J, Elissa J Chesler, Brian S Yandell, and Karl W Broman. 2019. “Testing Pleiotropy Vs. Separate Qtl in Multiparental Populations.” G3: : Genes, Genomes, Genetics. Genetics Society of America. https://www.g3journal.org/content/9/7/2317. Boehm, Frederick J., Brian S. Yandell, and Karl W. Broman. 2019. “Qtl2pleio: Testing Pleiotropy Vs. separate QTL in Multiparental Populations.” Journal of Open Source Software 4 (38): 1435. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01435. Costello, James C, Laura M Heiser, Elisabeth Georgii, Mehmet Gönen, Michael P Menden, Nicholas J Wang, Mukesh Bansal, et al.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Short courses and workshops Data Carpentry Social Sciences January 25-26, 2019, Arlington, Virginia, USA Data Carpentry Genomics September 15-16, 2018, Rolla, Missouri, USA Preparing to teach statistics (instructor) Spring 2018 Topic models for computational text analysis Summer 2016, Fall 2013 Formal courses Educating a diverse nation (co-facilitator) Spring 2017 (in-person) & Fall 2017 (online) Introductory statistics (instructor of record) Fall 2016, Spring 2016, Fall 2015, Summer 2015, Spring 2015, Fall 2014, Spring 2014
